reason: Species is mouse (rodent mode: allowed). In vivo single-unit electrophysiology (Neuropixels) in mouse hippocampus and visual areas is present.

header.title: Mega-scale movie-fields in the mouse visuo-hippocampal network

data_description.brain_region: Hippocampus (dentate gyrus, CA3, CA1, subiculum), visual areas (LGN, V1, AM-PM)
data_description.behavioral_condition: Head-fixed, passively viewing, immobile or spontaneously running
data_description.behavioral_task: Passive viewing of repeated silent movie clips (no explicit task, no reward, no locomotion requirement)

spike_level.sorting_method_software: Not specified (Allen Brain Observatory Neuropixels dataset, likely Kilosort or similar, but not stated in this paper)
spike_level.unit_inclusion_thresholds: Broad spiking neurons; significance of modulation by movie frames determined by z-scored sparsity > 2
spike_level.temporal_binning_filters: 33 ms bins for spike counts; z-scored sparsity and other metrics computed per frame
spike_level.computed_metrics: Z-scored sparsity, movie tuning percentage, firing rate modulation, number and duration of movie-fields per cell
spike_level.stat_controls: Chance levels determined by shuffling; significance by z-score > 2; Kolmogorov-Smirnov tests for group comparisons

spatial_level.frm_bin_size_coord: Movie frame (33 ms per frame); spatial location not relevant (head-fixed, non-spatial task)
spatial_level.normalization: Firing within movie-fields normalized by shuffle response
spatial_level.place_field_definition: Movie-field: segment of movie with significantly elevated firing (z-scored sparsity > 2)
spatial_level.spatial_metrics: Number of movie-fields per cell, duration of movie-fields, cumulative duration, mega-scale index (ratio of longest to shortest field per cell)
spatial_level.stability_remapping: Comparison of tuning between continuous and scrambled movie sequences; stability across trials and conditions
spatial_level.object_cue_related: Not specified (movie content is naturalistic, not object- or cue-specific)

population_level.correlation_measures: Pearson correlation for frame-to-frame similarity and for comparing cell responses across conditions
population_level.decoding_prediction: Decoding error of movie frame identity from population activity (see Methods, average decoding error computed)
population_level.synchrony_assembly: Multiple single-unit activity (MSUA) modulation compared to chance

temporal_network.sequences_replay: Not specified (no explicit replay analysis, but sequence encoding assessed via continuous vs scrambled movie)
